dependencies.description:
Beautiful Soup is a Python library for pulling data out of HTML and XML
files. It works with your favorite parser to provide idiomatic ways of
navigating, searching, and modifying the parse tree.
dependencies.name: py-beautifulsoup4

dependencies.description:
Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django
inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional
sandboxed environment.
dependencies.name: py-jinja2

dependencies.description:
This is a Python implementation of John Gruber's Markdown. It is almost
completely compliant with the reference implementation, though there are
a few very minor differences. See John's Syntax Documentation for the
syntax rules.
dependencies.name: py-markdown

dependencies.description:
This is an extension to Python-Markdown which provides an "include"
function, similar to that found in LaTeX (and also the C pre-processor
and Fortran).
dependencies.name: py-markdown-include

dependencies.description:
This is an extension to Python-Markdown which allows environment
variables to be used in the text.
dependencies.name: py-md-environ

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: Pygments is a syntax highlighting package written in Python.
dependencies.name: py-pygments

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm

dependencies.description:
This is a setuptools_scm plugin that adds support for git archives (for
example the ones GitHub automatically generates).
dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm-git-archive

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

description:
FORD, standing for FORtran Documenter, is an automatic documentation
generator for modern Fortran programs.
name: py-ford

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
